### **Nunavut Lake Sediment Survey Request for Proposal**

#### **Summary of Proposal**

The Geological Survey of Canada (GSC) is undertaking a comprehensive mapping and assessment project of Canada’s north under the GEM-GeoNorth program. This project aims to provide geologic knowledge for future natural resource exploration, balanced conservation, and responsible resource development. The proposal seeks tenders for a Nunavut Lake Sediment Survey, which will involve collecting approximately 1,200 to 1,500 samples of centre-lake bottom sediment and near-surface water over an area of approximately 18,000 km².

#### **Additional Information**

This tender is subject to the Directive on Government Contracts, Including Real Property Leases, in the Nunavut Settlement Area (Nunavut Directive). The solicitation is limited to bids from firms registered on the Inuit Firm Registry (IFR).

The objectives of this activity include increased participation by Inuit firms in business opportunities in the Nunavut Settlement Area economy, improved capacity of Inuit firms to compete for government contracts and real property leases in the area, and employment of Inuit at a representative level in the area workforce.
